tokens.name: Komoot App allows you to plan outdoor activities such as hiking, mountain biking, cycling and running.
It allows you track your route, how long is the activity, what is your average and current speed and how many minutes you are in motion.
In the profile tab you can see your planned and completed tours, your highlights and collections.
You can also follow other people and see their collections, so the app is useful for solo travels, but also finding others with similar passions and interests.
Komoot is a good navigation app,helping you find your way during the activities and track the progress you have made.
The app is user friendly and easy to navigate.
It allows you to follow other people to make friends or find inspiration in their hikes.
The free version is advanced and has a lot functions that you need.
In Plan tab there isnt a lot saved places in my area.
It does not show how much calories you burned during your activity.
Too many notifications sometimes.
You could improve by making yourself move visible, so more of my friends who hike and cycle can use it with me.
The app is for designing adventure routes for you to take through the country.
You can plan the route for walking, riding, tubing to get the best route.
It talks to you like normal maps would so you don’t have to take your eyes of the path.
Can be used offline so if you don’t have signal - no issue.
You can see peoples favourite places to go and then see their recommendations - and why.
Can be used across many devices including apple watches.
Can also be used in many places and countries.
It’s free to download and start a region but after that you are charged.
Which I understand but is a bit crap.
Shows good routes
Charged if our your area
Not sure on this one.
It's mostly made for planning your route when you go for a hike or a bike ride, for example.
You use the app to determine your route, but also smaller details like the elevation of ground, the type of ground that the route takes place on and so on.

Through the app you can also get offline maps for your hike and the GPS feature helps you navigate easier, you can also turn on the voice, so you don't have to use your phone to navigate and can listen to the directions given by the app.
You can also add pictures from your hike or whatever kind of trip you are having to share the story of that day.
The app can be also linked to multiple of different devices and it supports most e-health devices, such as smartwatches, to keep track on your pulse and other health data.
I like how useful it is, it really makes navigating and planning your routes easier.
The design of the app is pleasing to the eye and is overall very easy to use as well.
Offline features are great, as often internet connection is very bad in the nature.
I think the community features are a bit boring, I don't go for hikes to show off to other people, I do it for myself.
I also do not like, that the app is free only partially, to unlock different regions and areas, you have to pay.
Other than that, I can't think of anything else that I dislike.
I believe the paid features could be improved.
Perhaps they could increase the amount of free regions you get, when you register, or try and make more ad revenue to keep the app profitable.
The community features could be enhanced, currently they don't feel that relevant to me.
Komoot is trending for trekkers or cyclists because it’s a niche concept to create maps and routes for those looking to go on hikes, specific routes or just general messing around.
The app is easy to use and most people use it as their preferred app.

The app allows the user to choose elements of their route or their navigation with things like surface planning which is vital if you have any kind of injury or have a bike designed for a specific terrain.
It also looks at elevation which is good as fits in with user activity level and fitness.
You can correlate multiple routes.
You can also adjust the difficulty level.
I like how easy it is to set up maps and configure navigation.
I like I can adjust elevation as I don’t like high inclines.
I like how I can set it to terrain without too much surface issues.
Glitchy app.
Sometimes asks for waypoint and doesn’t navigate.
Some of the routes are poor and uninteresting.
Fix bugs!
Especially when trying to set a new route or alter my preferences and it makes it difficult to do so.
Seems to be getting worse over time.
I use the Komoot App to find hiking or biking itineraries, especially when I want to hike or bike in a new place that I do not know, sometimes in a foreign country.

The App offers a description of the itinerary, a map, a profile of the hike and other technical details (eg how much altitude gain), photos, a rating of the level of difficulty, some tips about how to make the most of it.
I like it that the itineraries are proposed by normal people, other hikers and bikers rather than by a tourist agency.
It's also great that it's not limited to one particular country, but rather it offers services for most countries where I wanted to hike until now.
I like that it covers more than one country - thus it's a easy point of access when traveling to a new place.
I like that it offers a map of the hike - like this its possible to easily figure out the whereabouts.
I like that normal hikers, bikers can contribute their own itineraries and that there's a community of users effect.
I like that there is a description of the outing - so as to know what to expect.
It's also great that there are photos so you can quickly figure out whether you would enjoy going there.
Sometimes the level of difficulty of a hike is not exactly as expected.
Or the hike description might not exactly be up to date with the itinerary on the ground.
For example when hiking in Switzerland, I prefer to use the Swiss Mobility app because it gives access to a very detailed map.

I already know pretty well the whereabouts and I find it very useful to have a detailed map, with GPS showing you exactly where you are, even if you temporarily have no internet access when trying out a new hiking itinerary.

On Komoot I haven't figured out yet whether I can use the map in the same way and whether it would really be up to date and showing all the detail even if my phone is offline (which happens pretty often when hiking in Switzerland).
Komoot App is a app that helps you find routs for hiking or for other kinds of outdoor activities.
It lets you choose the routs based on location length or difficulty.
There is many types of routes and you also get to customize the routs based on what is it that you want from the activity.
Kamoot app helps you be more organized and prepared for the outdoor adventure that you are planning.
It has different types of routes for road bikes, mountain bikes and for hikes and make it makes the experience of finding a route that you like much more easier.
Its a great way to also find new types of routes that you would not have had the pleasure of experiencing otherwise.

Very useful for planning routes
Easy to use 
Great routes

it drains your phone battery fast
Finding routes near you is sometimes too hard
A lot of bugs in the app
Adding more routes
Komoot App is a really useful app for those who like to go a bit etra when planning their cycling or biking trips.
You can nitpick on surface type,elevation,difficulty level,and many other features.
You can combine multiple routes into one and navigate accurately.
Komoot's greatest strenght as a route planner is its ability to create routes specifically for different outdoor activities,cycling,running,mountain biking, hiking etc.
This means you only need to have one app for everything!
You can browse existing tours under 'Discover' for routes created by users as well as the komoot team.
You can also build your own trips called 'Tours' by selecting the preferred route or routes,elevation,surface characteristics and other technical aspects of the trail.
I like Komoot because routing has useful features,offline mapping and navigation, voice guidance works well.
It highlights only as good as the people creating them,curated content hard to navigate.

1)The Komoot app can improve  App speed and reliability- The app can be slow on the iphone  even with the latest version..
2)User interactions,eg finishing a tour,searching for a location,viewing details about a place.
3)Contextual information- when a place is searched up,it would be nice to see results near by.
Komoot App helps planning, tracking and sharing trecks and hikes.
It enables saving the trails, so that other people can use them in their planning.
As a result, there is a huge amount of beautifully presented and described trails in many areas of the UK (I can't speak for another countries as I haven't used Komoot outside the UK).
Particularly useful features of the Komoot App to me are the ability to save pictures of several spots in the trail and seeing the incline profile.
Seeing the incline profile really saved me and my friend one time when we were deciding on a trail to be manageable before sunset (it was November, so early sunsets).
Particularly useful features of the Komoot App to me are the ability to save pictures of several spots in the trail and seeing the incline profile.
Seeing the incline profile really saved me and my friend one time when we were deciding on a trail to be manageable before sunset (it was November, so early sunsets).

We were also able to see the pictures of the trail, which helped us decide the direction of the circle we were making - we took on jumping across the river while it was still light and returned on a regular road when it got dark.
It would be great if the app was connected to other services such as FitBit.
It would be great if the App was able to connect to fitness tracking devices such as Fitbit, Apple watch or Whoop, perhaps through the Google Fit service, which can connect several of these devices.
This way data about heart rate and trail parameters would be automatically synced and gave a better picture of the strain at different trails.
The Kamoot App is a good to plan a route, to add waypoints along the way.
Is good for bikers and hikers.
On the map you can see a small red dots that are showing you recomended places that you can check out along the way.
The map works good.
The option for hikers is the best.
It always finds an interesting route for you, not just the abvious one.
You can add one or more points to your route.
You can also adjust your route, by changing which waypoint you want to go to firs, secont, third... You also have the option to record your tour.
With Komoot Premium you got the option to share your live location with family and friends.
That you can use it for free.
That if you really want to enjoy almost all of the features you have to pay.
The premium is a montly subscription.
Maybe if it was a one time payment would be better.
Like I stated before.
The premium will be more affortable if it was a one time payment not montly.
The Komoot App is an app that allows you to search and look for routes for biking, hiking and many more sportive activities.
It is the perfect planningtool to create routes and uses the best outdoor-technology available.
The app gives you a personalized log to bundle all your adventures.
The offline maps and turn-by-turn navigation provide a great way to stay on track during your hikes or bikerides.
The app gives different ways to filter for your desired route, you can select distance, difficulty and accessibility.

There's also an option to create your own path, it uses an algorithm in which you can select which sights you want to see, the kind of roads you want to take and the surface on which you will be walking.
The app is there for everyone who wants to elevate their sportive activities.

- That I can filter every single aspect of my walk
- That it gives me my walking data (i.e.
my speed, tracked distance etc.)
- The fact that I can connect with other people that took the same hike that I did and see what they thought about it

- The fact that the app sometimes has a bug 
- While using an app while walking I sometimes have a harder time switching off because I keep thinking about my phone, instead of focussing on the nature around me
- Not a lot of my friends use Komoot so I can't share my walks with them
I think what could be improved about Komoot is the stability of the application.
Sometimes I don't get the correct data (whilst my phone is saying GPS etc are connected).
It's not the most important thing to have the data after a walk but it's a fun way to motivate yourself sometimes.
Komoot is a navigation and exploration App.

It's strength is planning routes by different criterias such as difficulty, along certain types of ground or for different types of transportation (hiking, mountain biking, gravel riding, ...) and incorporating points of interest in these routes.
Besides that it has some social elements like sharing routes, voting on points of interest and sharing images.
You can plan you routes as you wish and then use the app or a generated gps file to navigate und track your workouts.
It also offers suggestions of where you could go for your next explorations.
It is very usefull thanks to this in getting to know your surroundings.
I like the way komoot suggest points of interest near me.
Moreover I like the way it enables customization of routes.
Lastly I like that it is very connected thanks to the app and also the ability to export gps files of my planned routes to use on bike computers.
What I don't like is that the UI is cumbersome and difficult to use in some places.
I don't think the discovery features is that great at suggesting interesting routes or showing of what makes the routes a good choice if I don't want to plan a ride on my own.
The calculated difficulty could give more insight into why this was chosen.
Is it because the route is very long, or because it is technically difficult, or because there is a lot of height to cover etc.
Komoot could be improved by giving you an indication of where you routes take place and where you don't know the area that well.
Imagine a heat map of your routes and showing "white spots" where you could check if there is something to discover.
The Komoot app is a free app for iPhone/ android owners which is designed for cyclists, walkers, runners.
It allows the user to find trails to follow or plan their own trails.
The user can also use the navigation on the app which helps direct the user to their destination.
You can choose difficulty in routes, allowing new cyclists/walkers or runners etc to start at an easier pace and gradually build up to a more demanding route once they have the confidence to do so.
The app allows the user to share their routes and journeys completed which gives a competitive edge and interactive style to the app.

- easy to plan routes 
- can upload photos to show friends/users your routes 
- free
- can choose routes based on difficulty
- review routes

- quite pricey if you wish to sign up to full version 
- some routes aren’t always great 
- doesn’t link to fitness, doesn’t show you cals burns like other competitors offer.
- revisit the routes listed, some routes which komoot suggest are not great, some seem a little bit out there and not safe to travel.

- lots of things to do on the app, which is great, but makes it difficult for a user to understand how to use the app to the best of its ability 
- tie in fitness with the app.
The strength of the app is planning and finding routes, however I would love to be able to track calories burnt etc.
Komoot is an app in which you can plan out your next route for a bike ride, hike or run.
The app gives you recommendations for routes in the places where you want to go or you can make up your own routes.
After you plan your route you can use the app for turn-by-turn navigation.
You can also track your routes and add photos and stories, which you can keep private or share with the community to get others inspired.
It also features an offline map, which comes in handy when there is no internet services on your route.
You can also see what other community members like and what their experience is on their routes.
I like that it is easily accessible and has everything in one app.
I do not have any dislikes
I do not have any improvements for the app
The Komoot App is a way to get information about the route you decide to take on your next ride, run, or hike in the mountains.
Getting around the mountains can be tricky, and Komoot helps you plan your route through voice navigation that doesn’t make you stare at your phone all day.
This is useful when trying to focus on the aesthetic and nature of your trip.
Offline maps for those times when cellular service is not reliable and always help you keep track of where you are.
Getting information on the communities favorite places is reliable because it allows for safe and trusted adventures.
Tracking your rides allows you to keep the memories of your adventures alive and allows your peers to interact with them which is an excellent added bonus.
Following specific friends who are interested in the same hobby is beneficial and useful.
Upvoting allows people to challenge each other when it comes to who wants to be the best adventure expert.
Apple Watch and apple health availability is fun.
I love that Komoot allows you to interact with other people that share the same hobby as you.
This allows you to make new friends and peers based on this hobby that would last a lifetime.
The availability of understanding the route that you are taking is great because it allows you to plan out your adventure before leaving.
Offline routing is important as well because you never know when you are going to be faced with difficulty on mountains and trails.
Google sign in availability would make it easier other than just having the options to link to Facebook or apple health.
I do not like how this app has the upvoting challenge as a part of it because it makes it more competitive than interactive.
I do not like how not many people know about this app.
It should be marketed more to reach the intended targeted audience.
It could be improved through adding more options for log in.
This could increase the number of people that would like to sign up because it would be easier overall.
The interactions within Komoot could be improved in a way that allows people to get to know each other better through profiles.
The graphics should remain nice and neutral as it is as well.
Komoot App is an all-in-one route planner and sharing app.
It is supported by a range of devices including Garmin, Wahoo, Sigma and Bosch.
It is free forthe 1st region and you have to pay to expand thereafter.
You can use it to plan your route for many sporting adventure activities such as cycling, hiking or running.
It is partly based on information shared by other users recommendations and knowledge.
You can plan your trail down to the difficulty level, terrain type, distance or even elevation.
It includes voice navigation, GPS tracking and has offline functionality.
Users can adds photos of routes used and offer tips.

I like that is has real life user recommendations
I like the voice navigation feature
I also like the variety of routes available.
I dislike that you have to pay to expand the regions available.
It uses up a lot of battery power on your mobile.
The GPS tracking can be a little patchy depending on location.
Improve the GPS funtion even in more remote arrears and lower the fee charged.
The Komoot app is a programme that allows the user to plan and actively navigate routes that the user wishes to follow.
The user can plan routes according to their own abilities.
The app provides information about the route such as areas of interest.
The app can also make suggestions about other potential routes, based on what the user has previously entered or used.
The app allows the user to track routes.
It has other features as well, such as the ability for the user to add personal information such as photographs.
The app can also integrate with other apps and devices, such as Garmin equipment.
I like that I can personalise my routes by adding photographs, I can make the route specific to my individual requirements and that it makes interesting suggestions for other routes.
I don't like the cost of the app, I find some if the features tricky to navigate and there are sometimes too many options for a simple route (when I just want to go somewhere!)
I think that having a simpler, or more basic, way of inputting routes would enhance the app for people like myself, who stick to simple routes.
That would save time and frustration in using the app.
The app provides you with all kinds of walking and bycycle tracks.
You can plan your route just like any other navigation app, but can use the kamoot database to add the hiking tracks or bycycle tracks.

You can choose different activities like walking, hiking, bycycle or mountainbike based on your own preference and you put in your start location and end location and the app calculates the route for you through the preffered activities best route.
There is also a premier version, which you have to pay for, where you can plan a route of preferred activity in multiple etappes.
This is usefull for when you are planning on a multiple day hike, or bikeride.
I like the simplicity of it.
I like to find new paths.
I like the fact that i can use it for free
I dont Like planning in the mobile app.
I dont like paying for the offline maps
More userfriendlyness in the mobile version.
It is not really easy to add waypoints or to see the highlights of the route
From what I know Komoot is a map app which is primarily used to select the best routes from and to a given destination.
I am aware of it in the context of finding hiking trails in protected areas and other natural settings.
The app can be used for route planning for hiking and cycling.
It was recommended to me because maps can be downloaded in advance and can later be used offline, in areas without phone reception.
A log of the route taken is also recorded.
As far as I know it is technically available worldwide but I have only used it in Western Europe.
I think that content is edited by users and includes reviews for given routes.
I like that it can be used offline because I often don't have phone reception in areas where I hike.
I like that many people can influence recommendations based on user experience.
Nothing really, sometimes I felt a bit overwhelmed by options!
I'm pretty happy with it.
maybe a built-in translator to understand reviews in different languages.
The Komoot App is a route planner application that is available for both Android and Apple devices.
You get access to pre-built routes in the form of collections, that you can use for your adventures both your local regions but also globally.
The app gives you the possibility to tag, share stories and photos with the Komoot community.
If you want to make your own route, the app gives you the possibility to do this effectively through an easily customizable user interface.
In the interface you can set up your route depending on your choice of your sport.
Maybe one of it's greatest assets is the turn-by-turn voice navigation that the app offers, giving you the right directions as you hike, bike and so on in an undisturbing fashion.

The ability to customize, and make my own routes

The idea of voice navigation when in activity ensuring you get where you are supposed to go

The ability to set up specific routes depending on your activity

There is quite a learning curve to make your own routes

Not always giving you the best routes

There are a lack in health monitoring features.
Definitely its health and fitness features.

Other similar products offer better range of tools for tracking your improvements, with features including a training calendar for totting up your mileage every month to heart rate and power data analysis.
Komoot is an app that helps plan routes for leisure (e.g.
hikes, bike rides and walks) that mainly covers a lot of regions in Europe.
I think that it's free and you just need to download the app and make an account.
It also measures the distance covered as well as sporting/activity stats that can be helpful to record progress over time.
It is adaptable, meaning that you can customise the route to your ability and views/sights that you want to see.
You can also share pictures/posts about your Komoot activity on the app so that your friends can see your activity which can boost motivation.
The app, after a while, will then start giving personalised and recommended trails.
I love the fact that it's tailored towards the user, so that, if they are a beginner, don't feel embarrassed or too daunted by a hard walk.
I also like the community side of the app where you can share posts and pictures relating to activity.
The fact that you can plan routes in advance is also handy in the way that it helps save time and you have the route on your phone too.
I question whether the app fully takes into account the user (what if the user has a slight disability?)
The cost - it would be great if it were free, or if you could have a family/couple payment, but it's understandable as it costs money to run and the current prices aren't too bad anyways.
No offline maps
Family/couple accounts could be great (e.g.
different profiles under one account) as to make it a fun activity that everyone can enjoy and track, but also create a competitive atmosphere (e.g.
challenges).
Komoot App is an application for route planning during your vacation.
It allows the user to navigate and develop outdoor routes.
It gives your suggestions based on the difficulty, your preferences, the type of transport you want to use (public transport, for example).
It's easy to use in the mountains, the app has hiking suggestions.
You can save your own adventures, share them with friends.
It's very convenient especially for people like me who are not good with using maps.
It also gives you so much information about the places.
Even the locals don't know this information!
My friends really like using it.

- It's easy to use
- It gives you a lot of different suggestions and additional information
- It navigates better than maps

- Not many people use it
- Doesn't always work in the mountains
- Doesn't work well on some devices
Compatibility with some devises can be improved.
Komoot is an app that has a collection of routes for walking and cycling ready to go.
People can search for routes totry, plan trips and log their adventures to share with friends.
The app can be used online and offline, routes can be filtered by region, length, modality and you can share tips too so other users can select routes based on others experiences.
Photos and stories can be added to routes to enhance this experience.
The app has been used in many countries so is good for trips away too.
The app is fun and easy to use, as well as free, helps people explore the outdoors and have new adventures
You can use others experiences, you can share photos.
And it is easy to filter the routes
There's a lot of notifications and it isn't very well known.
More personalisable,
Komoot app is an app for cyclists/walkers.
It allows them to plan their route based on ability and journey length.
It is essential to plan a route whether that be by bike or hike.
There are various ready made routes available.
It allows you to navigate an area you may not be aware of.
It is beneficial for explorers and those who enjoy the outdoors.
By using the app, you can plan a cycling or walking route not just in the UK but all around the world.
Once you complete a route, you can save it to re-do and also send to your friends.
The app is aesthetically pleasing and easy to navigate and to use.

-The app is easy to navigate
-Allows you to plan your route and not to worry about where you are going 
-Available all over the world

-Could use better colours 
-Only can use for bikes or hikes, not car journeys
-May be hard to understand for the older generation.
-Only way it could be improved is for it to be more attractive to potential younger audiences

The Komoot app offers routes and navigation to help adventurous people navigate the great outdoors

It offers route planning, navigation and suggested routes to give users some inspiration as to where they could go for a walk or a cycle ride.
You can also save your logs of where you have been and share these with your friends or other Komoot users.
Users can filter by distance, difficulty and can also take into account local transport links so yo can get home or get to the starting point of your walk or cycle route with ease.
It offers an all-in-one package for cycling, mountaineering and walking.
I find the app easy and intuitive to use and it is really useful as a navigation tool
In-app purchases
I find the cost of the world maps and the premium membership to be a little steep.
However people that use the app very frequently may be prepared to pay as they will get more benefit from it (I only go walking occasionally)

The Komoot App is a navigational aide which allows users to plan journeys (such as hikes, trails, bikes, horse-riding hacks and so on), and also allows data to be saved so that it can be accessed at a later date.

It can be accessed online and offline, and for this reason it is particularly suited to be used in 'off-grid' locations in which one cannot access signal; this is also a notable safety feature compared to other navigational systems.
The app builds up a profile of the user in order to provide inuitive and tailored recommendations for future journeys.
It is a little like Strava, except for the fact that Strava seems to be mainly designed for an urban environment and the lifestyle that Komoot 'endorses' is wilder, more rural.

- Comprehensive overview of possible routes
- Easy to use
- Attractive look

- Potential for data to be exploited
- Lack of visibility over how data is used
- Human creativity and character is eclipsed by this kind of tech
The basic fault I see is that it uses data to encroach on the user's ability to carry out the task themself.
Obviously eliminating this 'fault' would represent an existential threat to the app...
It`s an app that has cycling maps and hiking routes.
It helps active junkies to stay on track and not to get lost, it shows nice routes etc.
The basic version is free, upgraded is not, but that`s the case with most apps.
It helps you plan the route you want to go, you can filter by difficulty, distance, and public transport availability.
The app generates sport-specific, topographic routing.
Also you can add friends on there and see if you`re staying on the right path together.
The app is global which is great for travelling and discovering new hiking paths etc to stay active on your holiday no matter the place you are going too.
It seems easy to use, idea is nice in general
Paid membership but owner needs to earn money somehow
Cheaper membership, because 40 $ seems a bit much
The Komoot application allows users to plan and navigate a walk, hike or cycle.
Providing information on types of terrain and accurate GPS location.
Maps can be downloaded for use while off line or when mobile data is unavailable.
Trails are mapped with terrain listed for most areas along with an idea of duration, fitness even required plus the total distance that will be covered.
Photos also available of various points on each hike with access to weather forecast information for the duration of the hike available through a premium subscription.
Profile allows tours to be bookmarked amd shows planned and completed tours to keep history of walks & hikes.
Has a wide array of walking trails even in my local areas.
Can be hard on battery consumption
Less emails would be preferable, not sure if the premium subscription really provides enough additional features to make it worth it.
Komoot App is sports and activity app that you can use to plan hikes and adventures.
You can also interact with other users and share your trips with them.
Komoot App is kind of combination of Sports Tracker and Facebook.
With Komoot App for example you can find different hiking trails from one place and it will help you to navigate through the route.
The App will give you inside knowledge that you can use to determine whether some adventure is suitable for you or not.
I suppose you can also save photos and other notes regarding your adventures so the App functions as a diary as well.
The App lets you focus more on the adventure itself and you don't have to worry too much about the rest.
Komoot is versitile app and it has wide variety of different functions.
Possibility for offline navigation is a big plus and it is a great way to discover new interesting possibilities.
If you just want the basic information about your workout like distance traveled, time, pace and heart rate etc.
you would find it easier to use some other app/device instead.
If Komoot App is not popular among your friends maybe you are not getting the full benefit of using it.
If you are not exploring new places regularly but rather using familiar routes then you probably wouldn't be using the app so much.
As as current Polar user it's difficult to find reasons to use Komoot regularly.
Most of the time my sports watch offers all the necessary features and I don't need any additional navigation for example.
Komoot should offer some really simple integration that would give some extra value for average people.
Now using another app is probably too much extra hassle for most sports watch users.
The komoot app is a route planning app which allows people to follow pre planned routes, or enable them to create their own routes for either hiking,cycling or running.
It's an excellent way to keep a log of the routes that you have completed, which you can then share with friends and others using the app.
It logs your fitness information, and gives information about how difficult the route that you are taking is.
Komoot also collects 'highlights' which means that you can discover local hidden gems which you might otherwise have missed.
In the tour planner, you are able to plan a route from scratch, and input your type of transport for komoot to tailor an adventure just for you.
It's User friendly, and it's incredibly easy to share your journeys with friends.
I really enjoy the fact that Komoot can plan my journey for me, taking out all of the effort!
Sometimes the app shuts down randomly with no warning, and doesn't always save my information.
Other than that, I really like it!
I genuinely can't think of any way to make the app better, I'm sorry!
koomot is the most intuitive route planning app on the market.
with koomot i can easily adapt my hiking plans wherever I am, allowing me  to easily explore more of the outdoors.
Komoot has around 8 million users globally, about 4 million being cyclists, and 1.8 million of those are mountain bikers.

Users create their own routes, called “Tours” within Komoot (their mapping is built on OpenStreetMaps), and can tips and recommendations -like a great viewpoint, coffee shop, or trail segment- to their Tours, too.
These are called “Highlights”, and it’s cool because it gives you the ability to add those Highlights to your own routes, helping you find neat things in a new area.
In areas (like Europe, for now) where there’s a critical mass of Highlights and Tours, they have a feature called “Discover”.
Once activated for an area, you can search existing Tours and Highlights and choose one.
In addition to the user-created Tours, their internal teams also create routes using heat maps of wh

Activity-specific routes Komoot’s greatest strength as a route planner is its ability to create routes specifically for different outdoor activities like cycling, running, mountain biking, hiking, etc.
This means you only need to have one app for everything!
Loaded with features
Some users have complained, saying they don’t like Komoot’s route suggestions.
They either didn’t match their expectations or were unsafe for travel.
In some instances, Komoot also tends to suggest you the shortest route as opposed to the best one.
Lack of features on the fitness side
Komoot is a route planning platform designed for cyclers, mountain bikers, backpackers, and hikers.
You can use it to discover routes, plan new routes, and navigate a chosen route.
Although there are many other apps that offer the same functionalities, Komoot is equipped with a unique set of features.
App available for all locations worldwide tbr allows you to intuitively plan and log any journeys/hikes with suggestions for routes.
Making the great outdoors more accessible.
This app will be available worldwide on android and apple devices for people who appreciate finding new routes and trails.
Keep a record of each route and route suggestions.
Komoot utilises mech tech and software offering turn by turn voice activated tech.
Harnessing the latest software to cover topography and ability to suggest routes for a full range of sports.
Helping users to safely find new routes as a hobby sport or fitness activity as keeping healthy is the key.
I find that it’s clear and informative.
It’s organised and promotes that in the app user.
Helps with safety in that can give inch by inch advice.
A bit rigid in it’s approach.

Loss of sense of adventure 
Safety if you are sharing route on the app in general
Needs to include suggestions for people with physical and visual disabilities.
Could also include advice information for families as well as people using for sports hobby or fitness.
Offer suitable routes for people with accessibility needs
A route planner and satnav for cycling.
I used it a little bit, and it was better at it than Google Maps, but I found it wasn't as good as OpenCycleMap, CycleStreets and Cycle.Travel for route planning.
But it seems it has bigger PR and marketing budgets than those alternatives, so gets more publicity anyway.
If I recall correctly, it's supposed to be particularly for off-road / trails / bikepacking routes, which might be why I found it less useful for utility and on-road route planning.
And I think Komoot is the one that lets you share routes/rides, or at least, has some sort of functionality/content promoting set routes?

And I heard it's useful in the US and some other countries which don't have already have better mapping and route planning options, but I haven't been to those countries recently, so haven't found a lot of use for it.
The mapping was fairly clear, with good colour contrast.
It had contour/relief mapping.
The satnav layout was fairly clear and uncluttered - that's one thing it beats CycleStreets on.
The route-finding for cycle touring wasn't as good as Cycle.Travel when I used it.
The route-finding for urban/utility cycling wasn't as good as CycleStreets.
Expensive for what you get, compared to competitors - e.g.
mostly need to pay for the usable maps, and they're not even OS maps.
Improving the route-finding to include missing links, remove unsuitable links, and better prioritise the best links for cycling would probably be enough to get me to use it again.
Improving the competitiveness of the maps offer would be a bonus.
My friend used it for about four months.
This is really our only port of call for more than 200 kilometers.
It kept us on bike safe streets and helped us find points of interest.
It also has a great feature that lets you split your trip into days and take your stay into account.
It also shows the weather and when it will rain during the trip.
At first he was worried that it would lead him down a dangerous path, but now he doesn't even worry about it anymore.
He also marveled at some of the trails it took him, nice forest trails, deserted dirt roads, really good finds.
Overall i think the app is good for cyclists.
Very good for cycle touring.
The UI could be better in my opinion
The UI could be clearer and have a simpler UI
The Komoot app is an application that you can use to find or plan route for different activities.
For example you can use it to search running routes in your area or to plan your own running routes.
Once you have a route you can then use the app to navigate you once you are on your route ensuring you don’t get lost.
The app tracks data such as distance, speed and time etc.
for each pre programmed route (route from other users) they are listed as easy, medium, hard.
Some even say how much of each terrain there is on the route.
The app allows you to share routes you’ve made within the community and track your progress or save the routes that you have completed.
I like that the app is detailed.
It has lots of route on and you can see the difficult, type of terrain and estimated length of time it will take you.
I also like that the app directs you where to go.
I found the directions a little bit confusing.
Not sure they were 100% accurate and didn’t refresh or pick up alternative routes when roads are closed.
The phrase telling you that you are a certain distance from your route isn’t that helpful.
It could to adjust to tell you how to get back on route.
The app could be improved by refreshing the route if taken a wrong turn to get you back on track rather than saying that you are 200m north of your target.
I also found the app a little bit confusing to navigate whilst using.
So this could be made clearer.
